data.title: Move to libGDX base
data.body: Tìm hiểu Github và dùng libGDX Base.

data.title: Bullet, add userdata, use collisionworld instead of dynamics, implements some wrappers, add collision test
data.body:
- Add userData to btCollisionObject (the collision objects are reused)
- Add directors for some already implemented nested structs
- Add btCollisionObjectWrapper (swig can be a real pain sometimes...)
- Update the tests to use btCollisionObject and btCollisionWorld instead of dynamics
- Add a basic btCollisionWorldTest which doesn't use dynamics, only collision detection.

data.title: Changed javadoc for StringBuilder append long and int to reflect no memory allocation
data.body:
...nd

sorry it took so long, im the height of half-assery

data.title: SQLite implementation for Lwjgl and Android Project
data.body:
I recently explored some JDBC driver for SQLite (Android) and found out this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1728476/does-android-support-jdbc

All I could conceive from this was that a JDBC implementation for Android was not a feasible thing. So instead I wrote some cross-platform SQLite code for Lwjgl (i.e. Desktop) and Android.

The Lwjgl implementation uses SQLite JDBC from https://bitbucket.org/xerial/sqlite-jdbc/wiki/Home while the Android implementation only uses the Android SQLite API.

Moreover, please do some constructive comment on my implementation as I am a relatively junior programmer here.

And please give me a go-ahead if you find it good enough so that should further my work on it and start commenting the code and implementing it for other backends (currently only works on Desktop and Android).

data.title: Added Polygon to ShapeRenderer
data.body: It would be great to add FilledPolygon too, but I have no clue.

data.title: Fixed spelling in documentation comment
data.body: Fixed obvious spelling error.

data.title: Adapts GLEED system to new maps API
data.body:
Keeps the same features but adds flexibility thanks to the new API
Moves GLEED to the core. Even though GLEED it's Windows only, anyone could write a script to convert between formats.

I'd be happy to make changes if needed.

data.title: Remove global shared state mutation from Vector2d.lerp()
data.body:
Vector2d was using the global tmp() scratch space, which is inherently sketchy.  Changed lerp to do the computation inline without mutating the target parameter or using the tmp global.

Add a Vector2dTest test case and add the test case to GdxTests.tests.

data.title: Improved API docs of Array class
data.body:
Found myself guessing whether 'identity' in Array.removeValue(T, boolean) stands for 'use equals()' or 'use ==', so decided to add explicit api docs just like other methods have. Useful.

Also added some to other methods. Not for all though (yet?).

data.title: javadoc fixups for com.badlogic.gdx
data.body:
Add details about other backends, fixup some spelling errors, remove stale documentation from InputProcessor, Graphics, and Net.

Most of the changes are really simple, but in a couple places I expanded the doc from "this on Android, that on Desktop" to a longer list (including GWT, and iOS).  I'm not sure if you'd like this to happen this way, or if the documentation in this platform independent code should just be more vague about the platform specifics?  (E.g., just say "some platforms may not have touch, and will support a mouse." as opposed to enumerating the backend specifics?)

Also, I noticed that the GWT and iOS documentation isn't published with the nightlies.  Is that intentional or on a todo list already?  Is it okay to create {@link} references from the generic code into these backends?

The github diff viewer doesn't seem to be wide enough to accommodate the javadoc, which makes the diff annoying to review.  Sorry about that.  Reformatting the javadoc would probably be more annoying.... :)

data.title: Update gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/math/Matrix4.java
data.body: improved the setToProjection() comment - noted on how to calculate the aspect ratio

data.title: Add TextureAttribute, Renderable, NewModel, Light, TextureDescription. M...
data.body: ...ove shaders to glsl files. Add basic lighting support.

data.title: Fixes to Slider and TexturePacker2
data.body:
Slider:

Clamped value to min and max in setRange.
Allowed min to be same as max.
Added check, if min is the same as max, avoid division be zero.

TexturePacker2:

Added possibility to force the output texturepack to be square (can be set by boolean forceSquareOutput. My motivation is the following: in some cases mipmaps don't work unless the texture is square.

BTW: Sorry for making another pull request as I did not find out how to update the previous one.

data.title: Let unchecked exceptions thrown in a Runnable kill the app do not just eat them.
data.body:
Also, do not hold the lock on runnables across invocation of the callbacks. 
Its fine to add more runnables while the executed runnables list is
being run through.

Add a test case too.

data.title: PixmapPacker didn't duplicate borders.
data.body:
Previous code was based on routine from TexturePacker but Pixmap takes
different parameters to Graphics2D.
Blending function restored after duplicating borders for efficiency.

data.title: Scene2d Slider SetRange fix
data.body:
SetValue() was called in SetRange. In my opinion this very undesirable behavior for the following
reasons:
- The value that the Slider originally had is now lost.
- changed() callback is called unnecessarily.

My recommendation is to just remove this line. If the user desires to
change the slider value after settings the range, he can do it by
calling setValue().

data.title: Fix for TexturePacker2
data.body: When duplicating borders, the top left corner of an image was duplicated to every corner of the image on the atlas.

data.title: Support for GL config in LWP, fallback to RGB565 if config not found.
data.body:
- Current LWP backend doesn't pass though the application config/GL config. -> made it read the config.
- GDXEGLconfigchooser currently returns null if you ask for a config that isn't available, so just return RGB565 if requested config is not found.

I commented out the code about the GT-I7500 since it seems to have been removed from the AndroidGraphics counterpart code and checked for elsewhere: https://github.com/Opotech/libgdx/blob/gdxclean/backends/gdx-backend-android/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/android/AndroidGraphics.java#L260

data.title: Separate classes, remove casting, add alias instead.
Add material.attribute
Add deregister methods for drag and drop target/source
Remove interfaces, add some helper methods.
Few changes and test for new material.
spelling: wheter -> whether
data.body: Just a common spelling mistake.

data.title: Implemented workaround for ObjectAL crash on iOS backend
data.body:
There's an ObjectAL issue that appears if you switch back and forth between apps that utilize sound.  On occasion, ObjectAL could crash.  See here for the workaround: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/objectal-for-iphone/ubRWltp_i1Q for details.

This pull request includes:
- ObjectAL updates for the assembly and .jar file (exposed forceEndInterruption method)
- Update to IOSApplication, implementing the workaround

data.title: Add meshpart support, change the way suggested shaders are handled.
Add RenderContext
New3dapi, cleanup and use separate renderer per shader
Modified isAnimationFinished when looping
data.body: Always return false if the current animation is looping

data.title: Merge master, add gles20 renderer
